intro: Verbascum kindlii, commonly known as the Mexican mullein, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and large, fuzzy leaves. The plant produces showy, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or arid environments. Verbascum kindlii is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional medicine.
